s:workflowdescription.author: Peter Li
s:workflowdescription.title: Identification of differential genes using t-tests by R

s:scufl.s:workflowdescription: This workflow starts by retrieving the names of microarray datasets from the Maxd database. The user has to select sets of control and test data for analysis using t-tests by R. A list of significant differentially expressed genes is then analysed using the Go Term Finder tool which generates a list of GO terms associated with the genes. A CSV file containing the list of significant genes is also generated.

s:processor.name: performT_testsUsingLIMMA
s:processor.s:description: This R script performs a series of t-tests for each gene expression level between its 2 input data sets using the LIMMA package from Bioconductor.

s:processor.name: getNamesUsingXPath
s:processor.s:description: Parses the measurement names of microarray datasets from the XML output from maxdBrowse

s:processor.name: createFinalCSV
s:processor.s:description: Creates a text file in CSV format contain a list of the all the differentially expressed genes identified by the R script.

s:processor.name: cleanCSV
s:processor.s:description: Removes unneccesary prefix text in the affy identifiers from the CSV file output generated by the R script

s:processor.name: createGeneList
s:processor.s:description: Create a list of genes for analysis by the GOTermFinder service. Spurious genes are removed including those which have been annotated as questioable and hypothetical and therefore will not have a GO term asscoiated with them.

s:processor.name: selectTestData
s:processor.s:description: Uses Java Swing classes to enable the user to select data sets for t-test analysis

s:processor.name: getAffyIds
s:processor.s:description: Parses the affy identifiers from the CSV file

s:processor.name: mergeOutput2
s:processor.s:description: Combines the selected data sets into a single data set

s:processor.name: selectControlData
s:processor.s:description: Uses Java Swing classes to enable the user to select data sets for t-test analysis

s:processor.name: mergeOutput1
s:processor.s:description: Merges the selected input data sets into a single data set

s:processor.name: queryMaxd2
s:processor.s:description: Will take a list of Gene names, a list of Measurement names and a list of Column Types and produce a table. All values are coloured in relation to the a reference. In the list of Measurement names, the first Measurement listed is taken to be the reference. Formatted as text.

s:processor.name: queryMaxd1
s:processor.s:description: Will take a list of Gene names, a list of Measurement names and a list of Column Types and produce a table. All values are coloured in relation to the a reference. In the list of Measurement names, the first Measurement listed is taken to be the reference. Formatted as text.

s:processor.name: getGeneName
s:processor.s:description: Gets the gene name for a given yeast open reading frame number

s:processor.name: analyseGenesPDFOutput
s:processor.s:description: Analyses a list of genenames using the GOTermFinder service

s:processor.name: getMeasurementNames
s:processor.s:description: Querys the maxdload database using maxdBrowse to obtain a list of measurement names from the big experiment data stored there

s:processor.name: getTargetDescription
s:processor.s:description: Gets a description of a given affy identifer using the YeastAffymapper service

s:processor.name: getTranscriptId
s:processor.s:description: Gets the open reading frame number for a given affy identifier

s:metadata.s:description: A PDF document generated by the GoTermFinder service
A text file in CSV format showing a list of differentially expressed genes and their annotations

A text file in CSV format shoing a list of genes annotated as hypothetical, questionable, genomic sequences, etc. These genes do not have a GO term associated with them and so are removed from the list sent to the GoTermFinder service.
